briefdescription.para: Enum describing transport type for LinphoneAddress.
Object that represents a SIP address.

detaileddescription.para: The LinphoneAddress is an opaque object to represents SIP addresses, ie the content of SIP's 'from' and 'to' headers. A SIP address is made of display name, username, domain name, port, and various uri headers (such as tags). It looks like 'Alice <sip:alice@example.net>'. The LinphoneAddress has methods to extract and manipulate all parts of the address. When some part of the address (for example the username) is empty, the accessor methods return NULL.

briefdescription.para: Enum describing transport type for LinphoneAddress.
Constructs a LinphoneAddress object by parsing the user supplied address, given as a string.
Clones a LinphoneAddress object.
Increment reference count of LinphoneAddress object.
Decrement reference count of LinphoneAddress object.

detaileddescription.para: When dropped to zero, memory is freed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the address scheme, normally "sip".
Returns the display name.
Returns the username.
Returns the domain name.
Get port number as an integer value, 0 if not present.
Sets the display name.
Sets the username.
Sets the domain.
Sets the port number.
Set a transport.
Removes address's tags and uri headers so that it is displayable to the user.
Returns true if address refers to a secure location (sips)
Returns true if address refers to a secure location (sips)
Make the address refer to a secure location (sips scheme)

parameterdescription.para: TRUE if address is requested to be secure.

briefdescription.para: returns true if address is a routable sip address
Get the transport.
Get the value of the method parameter.
Set the value of the method parameter.
Returns the address as a string.

detaileddescription.para: The returned char * must be freed by the application. Use ms_free().

briefdescription.para: Returns the SIP uri only as a string, that is display name is removed.

detaileddescription.para: The returned char * must be freed by the application. Use ms_free().

briefdescription.para: Compare two LinphoneAddress ignoring tags and headers, basically just domain, username, and port.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling if the LinphoneAddress objects are equal.

briefdescription.para: Compare two LinphoneAddress taking the tags and headers into account.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling if the LinphoneAddress objects are equal.

briefdescription.para: Set the password encoded in the address.

detaileddescription.para:
It is used for basic authentication (not recommended).
addr
the LinphoneAddress
passwd
the password to set.

briefdescription.para: Get the password encoded in the address.

detaileddescription.para:
It is used for basic authentication (not recommended).
addr
the address
the password, if any, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set a header into the address.

detaileddescription.para:
Headers appear in the URI with '?', such as <sip:test@linphone.org?SomeHeader=SomeValue>.
addr
the address
header_name
the header name
header_value
the header value

briefdescription.para: Get the header encoded in the address.
Destroys a LinphoneAddress object (actually calls linphone_address_unref()).
Create a LinphoneAddress object by parsing the user supplied address, given as a string.

parameterdescription.para: String containing the user supplied address

briefdescription.para: SIP address parser API.

detaileddescription.para: This api is useful for manipulating SIP addresses ('from' or 'to' headers).
